title: quirky blackletter
content:
This is a typeface I have been working on for a couple of years, and I have not been able to get to a point where I feel it is finished. I think it is the puncuation and non-letter characters that I do not like. It is mostly a display face but I do envision it being used for small blocks of text. I would appreciate any comments.

I am also looking for any ideas on what to name the typeface.

[http://www.typefetish.com/itw/quirkblklttr.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318000012/http:/www.typefetish.com/itw/quirkblklttr.pdf "http://www.typefetish.com/itw/quirkblklttr.pdf")

Thanks  
Michael
author: Michael Wallner

comments.content: that is an amazing looking font. Bard, Jester, and Armada are all ones that have been taken but might fit that.

I have to agree. There is something nice about this. It sits nicely somewhere in between handlettered and rigid typeface. I don't think I'd suggest regularizing at all.

Do you think you will try to create more weights or widths?

I have already started a version of alternative characters with some flourishes and a large set of ligatures, but I don't want to get to far into the designing of them until I get the base finished. I have also thought about some kind of Initial Caps but haven't done any work on them.
